full_text:
Writing Claim and Exposure Validation Rules

Lesson
objectives

¢ Describe the ClaimCenter validation model
¢ Write validation rules for claims and
exposures

| How ClaimCenter validates data Gi

* Two ways:
¢ Validation by field ensures that data is of valid type, range, and so on
* Validation by rules manages and enforces object maturity

¢ Both occur when an object is updated

[ © iP Code :'10013-123' is not properly formatted: ZIP Code must be a five- or nine-digit postal code

2IP Code | 10013-1234 || Responsible Parties

Party Classification Strategy = Liability%* =
Fred Jonesi518039234058 | Insured  ¥ | Pursueagainst Insurer + %

‘Stan Newton <none> > Utilize Collection Agency > %

Claim Total: $0 008,
"Validation Results

Validation Results

| Validation by fields G

¢ Widgets enforce data type
¢ Validation expressions ensure that data is of correct format, range, and so on

« Warning and error messages appear on the current screen

{ @ ZIP Code :'10013-123' is not properly formatted: ZIP Code must be a five- or nine-digit postal code

ZIP Code [ 10013-123#

validationExpression “gw. api.contact .AddressAutocompleteUtil.validate (addressOwner.AddressDelegate, "PostalCode",

gw.api.address .AddressCountrySettings.getSettings (addressOwner.SelectedCountry) . PostalCodeLabel)

(Can be arbitrarily complex)

Validation rule sets i

showing validatable entities

| What can be validated

¢ Any entity that utilizes the Validatable delegate

¢ Provides two interfaces, ValidatablelnternalMethods
and ValidatablePublicMethods

¢ There are several Validatable entities in the
ClaimCenter base configuration

| Validation by rules Gi

¢ Rules prevent values from being saved which are inappropriate to the entity's
current maturity level

¢ Use “reject” methods to provide warning and error messages to the user

« Warning and error messages appear in a Validation Results worksheet in the lower part of the
screen

Af (totalexpliability > 100) {
claim. reject (T¢_NEWLOSS,
"(rwleNumber)\: Total Liability Percentage for ...", null, null)

‘tan Newton <none> > | | Utilize Collection Agency >
Claim Total: 120.0%

Validation Results

Validation Results

another page

| ValidationLevel

¢ Typelist that provides a set of maturity levels for claims and exposures

* The base configuration provides five validation levels

¢ In order, they are:

loadsave — entity loaded from an external
FNOL system*

newloss — entity newly entered by an agent*

iso — entity ready to send to ISO (the Insurance
Services Office) (fraud prevention)

external — entity ready to send to external
systems

payment — entity is ready for payment to
claimants*

fie) ValidationLevel.ttx

al typecode V

YshowAly ig = =

Element Code Name Zesty

Valid for ISO 250
Send to external sy... 200

typecode —_iso
typecode

external
loi

* These three validation levels are “final” and cannot be edited or deleted.

| How ClaimCenter uses validation levels Gi

Validatable entities have an actual or implied ValidationLevel

Entities are validated whenever a user or process attempts to save them
* Validates minimum data completeness and correctness at each maturity level
« Ensures that entities do not move “backwards” through the process

Entities are promoted through the Validation Levels

Prevents save if changes do not meet standards for the current level of validation

| Validation can prevent saving

state =CA
level = 3

county = null
state =CA
level = 2

& required

County present —
Promote to Level 3

County missing —
et |]
DO NOT SAVE

| Entities are promoted to the highest possible maturity level Gi

o= County is e= Inspection
& required & must be done
county = null

state = CA ea at
inspection = done County missing —

level = 2 DO NOT PROMOTE

county = Kern
state = CA
inspection = done
level = 24

County present — Inspection done —
PROMOTE PROMOTE

| Related objects can trigger validation Gi

¢ Updating some objects with a foreign key (child) relationship to a Validatable
object can cause the object to be validated

* Caused by a property, triggersValidation, on the array that implements the parent relationship

| Errors and warnings Gi

¢ Errors prevent an object from being promoted to and saved at a given level, and
display an explanatory message

¢ Warnings permit promotion and saving, but display a cautionary message

Error Error message

| Demonstration G
Writing Claim and Exposure Validation Rules

click here

Note: The demonstration opens a new tab in your browser. When the demonstration ends, the
original course launch window appears. Return to this window to continue this presentation.

Question

_— — Inwhat two ways does ClaimCenter validate data?

¢
7
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer

,— — Inwhat two ways does ClaimCenter validate data?

¢
7

“ The correct answer is that validation by field ensures that data is of valid type, range,

and so on, while validation by rules manages and enforces object maturity.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Question

i i i?
,— — When are claims and exposures validated?

¢
7
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Answer

i i i?
,— — When are claims and exposures validated?

¢
7
¢

The correct answer is when an attempt is made to save them.

SS eeesee seen ee ese

| entity.reject() method

* Syntax:
entity.reject(errorLevel, errorMessage,
warnLevel, warnMessage)
* Parameters:
* errorLevel = validation level to display an error message
* errorMessage = error message to display
* warnLevel = validation level to display a warning message

* warnMessage = warning message to display

+ Either errorLevel and errorMessage, or warnLevel and warnMessage, must be
non-null

* Both pairs can be non-null

* errorLevel should be a higher maturity level than warnLevel

| entity.rejectField() method G

* Indicates a problem with a particular field, displays a warning or error message and highlights
the field in the UI

* Syntax:

entity.rejectField(strRelativeFieldPath,
errorLevel, errorMessage,

warnLevel, warnMessage)
New Parameter:
e strRelativeFieldPath = the path from the root object of this rule to the field failing validation

claim. rejectField("FaultRating",TC_NEWLOSS,
"{ruleName}\: The Fault Rating must be determin...", null, null)

| entity.rejectSubField() method Ga

¢ Highlights fields on related objects (such as those on an array or a foreign key)
« May require navigation to a page for the related object field (which will be highlighted)
¢ If so, a link will be available in the Validation Results worksheet

¢ Syntax:

entity.rejectSubField(relatedObject, strRelativeFieldPath,
errorLevel, errorMessage,

warnLevel, warnMessage)
« New Parameter:
¢ relatedObject — the sub-object on which the reject field is found

claim.rejectSubField(exp, "OtherCoverageDet",
TC_NEWLOSS, "Please provide information about claimant's ot...",
null, null)

Validation rules

Most of the logic is usually in the condition clause

* Selects entities that should be rejected

¢ You can put additional logic into the action clause

USES:
uses gw.api.locale.DisplayKey
CONDITION (claim : entity.Claim):

return claim.Evaluations.where(\evaluation -> evaluation.isChanged()).hasMatch
(\evaluation -> {

var liabilities = {evaluation.InsuredLiability, evaluation.ClaimantLiability,
evaluation. OtherLiability}
return liabilities.where(\liability -> liability != null).sum() > 100
»
ACTION (claim : entity.Claim, actions : gw.rules.Action) :

claim. reject (claim.ValidationLevel, "Total liability percentage of evaluation canno...

, null, null)
END

Question

,— — What method would you use to reject a claim or exposure and indicate a
: specific field in that object?

7
¢

SS Seeoesese sees ee ese

Gi

Answer

_— — What method would you use to reject a claim or exposure and indicate a
: specific field in that object?

7
¢

The correct answer is entity.rejectField().

SS eeesee seen ee ese

Gi

| Student exercise

Validation for claim fields

| Student exercise

Challenge requirement:
Validation for exposure lists

objectives ¢ Describe the ClaimCenter validation model
review ¢ Write validation rules for claims and

exposures
